conclusion: To solve the problem, I will analyze the forces acting on the block and plate system, use the given relationship between velocity and time, and apply the equations of motion to find the coefficient of kinetic friction.

The image shows a block with mass m placed on a plate with mass M. The system is on a horizontal surface, and the block does not leave the plate. The relationship between the velocity of the block and time is shown in Figure B.
The block and plate system has a total mass of M + m.
The block is placed gently on the plate at t = 0, so the initial velocity v0 = 0.
The acceleration due to gravity is g = 10 m/s^2.
The force of kinetic friction fk acts opposite to the direction of motion, and its magnitude is given by fk = mu1 (M + m) g.
The net force acting on the block and plate is fk - (M + m) g.
Using the equation of motion v = v0 + at, where a is the acceleration.
Substitute fk = mu1 (M + m) g into the equation: v = (1/2) (mu1 g - g) t^2
The relationship between velocity and time is: v = (1/2) (1/2 mu1 - 1) g t^2
Equate the two expressions for v and solve for mu1: (1/2) (1/2 mu1 - 1) g t^2 = (1/2) (mu1 - 1) g t^2
